event.summary: 08/19/1993: An assailant opened fire on Dr. George Tiller outside an abortion clinic in Wichita, Kansas, United States. Dr. Tiller, an abortion doctor, was injured in both arms. An anti-abortion extremist, identified as Rachelle "Shelley" Shannon, was convicted for carrying out the attack.
event.motive: To protest the practice of abortion and to sabotage abortion facilities operating in Kansas.
event.weapdetail: A .32-caliber gun was used in the attack.
event.addnotes: Shannon was also convicted for carrying out several firebomb attacks on abortion clinics in Caliornia, Nevada, and Oregon in 1992.
event.scite1: Ronald J. Ostrow and James Risen, "U.S. to Act in 10 Abortion Clinic Attacks : Indictments: Charges are expected against an extremist in prison for attempted murder. Authorities hope action will lead to names of others," Los Angeles Times, October 23, 1994.
event.scite2: Dirk Johnson, "Abortions, Bibles and Bullets, And the Making of a Militant," The New York Times, August 28, 1993.
event.scite3: Harriet Ryan, "Kopp fifth clinic shooter to face trial," Court TV, March 11, 2003.
